newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Former Belgian minister detained in Cools murder.
newsitem.headline: Former Belgian minister detained in Cools murder.

text.p: The Belgian judiciary has arrested former regional minister Alain Van der Biest after a night of questioning, Belgian radio said on Sunday.
The radio quoted his lawyer as saying that Van der Biest had been detained in connection with the unsolved murder of Belgian politician Andre Cools in 1991.
On Friday Belgian police arrested Van Der Biest's former secretary, Richard Taxquet, along with three others, also in connection with the murder investigation.
The radio said Van Der Biest's arrest stemmed from testimony given by Taxquet under interrogation.

Belgian Justice Minister Stefaan De Clerck said on Friday that "an important breakthrough" had been made in the five-year-old investigation, which has uncovered a massive corruption scandal in connection with purchases of army helicopters.
That scandal brought down former Belgian NATO Secretary-General Willy Claes and four Belgian federal government ministers, and led to the suicide of a Belgian general.
